With the switch open, the total resistance is R1 + R2 = 30Ω. The power P0 consumed by this circuit is P0 = I0 × U = 0.5A × U.
When the switch is closed, the circuit remains the same, and I = I0 = 0.5A. The power consumed by the circuit with the switch closed is P = I × U = 0.5A × U.
Since the voltage U remains unchanged, P/P0 = 1, showing that P = P0.
Given P0 = 15W, we find P = P0 = 15W.
When the switch is open, the power consumed by the circuit is P0 = 0.5A × 30Ω = 15W. Therefore, when the switch is closed, the power consumed by the circuit is equal to 15W.
